purpose: Overview of TypeScript type definitions, interfaces, and enums used throughout the Akeyless server commons package. These types ensure type safety, consistency, and provide clear contracts for all modules including helpers, managers, and middlewares.

categories.name: types/ - Type Aliases
categories.description: Core type definitions for HTTP responses, middleware, routes, Firebase operations, and application-level helpers.

modules.name: types/global.ts
modules.description: Core types for Express middleware, routes, JSON responses, and app helpers. Exports: JsonOK<T>, JsonFailed, MW, Service, Route, MainRouter, AddAuditRecord, LangOptions, EntityOptions

modules.name: types/firebase_types.ts
modules.description: Firebase Firestore query and snapshot types. Exports: Query function types (QueryDocument, QueryDocuments, etc.), Snapshot types (OnSnapshotConfig, Snapshot, etc.), WhereCondition interface, InitSnapshotsOptions interface

categories.name: interfaces/ - TypeScript Interfaces
categories.description: Interfaces for configuration objects, data models, and middleware options.

modules.name: interfaces/global.ts
modules.description: Middleware and app configuration interfaces. Exports: MandatoryObject, MandatoryParams, LogRequests, AppOptions

modules.name: interfaces/email.ts
modules.description: Email data models. Exports: EmailData, EmailAttachment, EmailSettings

categories.name: enums/ - Enumerations
categories.description: Shared enums and service name type definitions.

modules.name: enums/global.ts
modules.description: Platform-wide enums. Exports: SimProvider, NxServiceName, NxServiceNameMap

categories.name: index.ts - Barrel Export
categories.description: Barrel export file that re-exports all types, interfaces, and enums for convenient importing.

context: Type Safety - Compile-time type checking across all modules
Consistency - Standardized types ensure consistent API shapes
IntelliSense - Better IDE autocomplete and documentation
Refactoring Safety - TypeScript catches breaking changes
Documentation - Types serve as inline documentation
